bioghist.p: Emily Kimbrough (1899-1989) was a 1921 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She worked as a fashion editor for Marshall Field (1922-1927) and then briefly for Ladies' Home Journal, before becoming the magazine's managing editor, a post she held from 1927 to 1929. She wrote numerous short stories, plays, and books. Kimbrough's titles include Our Hearts Were Young and Gay, So Near and Yet So Far, and Now and Then.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Emily Kimbrough's manuscripts and includes drafts of essays, short stories, plays, and novels. The collection also includes correspondence and three sets of printer's proofs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
